com.scorch.core

Class ScorchCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
      • org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
        • com.scorch.core.ScorchCore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin

    public class ScorchCore
extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
    The Core class of the plugin All initialisation is done here and it's used a central piece of the plugin. You can get this instance by using getInstance() which you can use to access the modules
    Version:
    0.0.1

        private void loadModules(ModulePriority priority)

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        ModulePriority

      • getRegisteredModules

        private java.util.Map<AbstractModule,ModulePriority> getRegisteredModules()
        Gets the list of registered modules that need to be initialised. They will be registered based on their ModulePriority
        Returns:
        the list of registered modules
        See Also:
        ModulePriority

      • registerModule

        public AbstractModule registerModule(AbstractModule module,
                                     ModulePriority priority)
        Registers a module to be initialised. Modules will be initialised using ModulePriority.
        Parameters:
        module - the module to register
        priority - the module's priority
        See Also:
        ModulePriority

      • getModule

        public AbstractModule getModule(java.lang.String id)
        Gets the module from the registered modules. Returns null if the module doesn't exist, so make sure the id is correct and the module exists
        Parameters:
        id - the module id to use
        Returns:
        the module
